word:
Note also (2) the principle that our minds may not be prepared to see the importance of surrendering ourselves to do that which ought to be done when God's servant is located for a time in a certain field. "You may not be able," she wrote, "to see all the particulars involved in this request of God to impart. But the special work has been laid out, and you are called upon to do your God-given duty." 


                               -397-
